answers.answer: Hi there!As single elevated value may not necessarily indicate diabetes since this may occur due to stress, temporary hormonal/ endocrine issues etc aside testing errors. It might be worthwhile taking a few more readings, before and after food on different days and taking a few random readings. If most of the readings remain high, you might consider seeing a primary care physician or an endocrinologist for confirmatory testing and suggestion of an appropriate management plan.Hope this is helpful.Take care!

question: I have hypoglycemia and my blood sugar usually run less than 100 after eating, but yesterday I spiked to 176. Should I be worried this is turning into diabetes? I have also been waking up 6-8 times through the night to pee!Thank you for your input...Faith
title: Hypoglycemia turned into Diabetes???
